q: Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.
h:
“Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple.
h:
“The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple.” —
Alan Watts

q: We run to win, not just to be in the race.
h:
“We run to win, not just to be in the race. ” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Anyone who has ever made anything of importance was disciplined.
h:
“Anyone who has ever made anything of importance was disciplined.” —
Andrew Hendrixson

q: The road to success is always under construction.
h:
“The road to success is always under construction.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages.
h:
“Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages. ” —
George Washington

q: The act of taking the first step is what separates the winners from the losers.
h:
“The act of taking the first step is what separates the winners from the losers.” —
Brian Tracy

q: The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.
h:
“The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.” —
Brian Tracy

q: The wise accomplish all that they want without arousing the envy or scorn of others.
h:
“The wise accomplish all that they want without arousing the envy or scorn of others.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
h:
“Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.
h:
“Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.” —
Mother Teresa

q: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
h:
“When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.” —
Carol Burnett

q: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.
h:
“Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.” —
Plato

q: If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.
h:
“If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.” —
Unknown

q: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
h:
“Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: The difference between winning and losing is most often not quitting.
h:
“The difference between winning and losing is most often not quitting.” —
Walt Disney

q: A memory is a beautiful thing, it's almost a desire that you miss.
h:
“A memory is a beautiful thing, it's almost a desire that you miss.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: To be able to forget means sanity.
h:
“To be able to forget means sanity.” —
Jack London

q: Enlightenment is intimacy with all things.
h:
“Enlightenment is intimacy with all things.” —
Dogen

q: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
h:
“There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Whether you have a problem in your life or not depends upon your own attitude, your own understanding.
h:
“Whether you have a problem in your life or not depends upon your own attitude, your own understanding.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
h:
“A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.” —
Charles Dickens

q: There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.
h:
“There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.
h:
“Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.” —
Rumi

q: Your setback is just a setup for a comeback.
h:
“Your setback is just a setup for a comeback.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Creative endeavors are by their nature uncertain.
h:
“Creative endeavors are by their nature uncertain.” —
Robert Greene

q: Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.
h:
“Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.” —
Les Brown

q: There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.
h:
“There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
h:
“Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love. ” —
Lao Tzu

q: Leadership starts at the top.
h:
“Leadership starts at the top.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: Walk slowly but never walk backward.
h:
“Walk slowly but never walk backward.” —
Unknown

q: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
h:
“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.
h:
“Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Learn only how to avoid seeking for and attaching yourselves to anything.
h:
“Learn only how to avoid seeking for and attaching yourselves to anything.” —
Huang Po

q: Winners are not people who never fail, but people who never quit.
h:
“Winners are not people who never fail, but people who never quit.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.
h:
“We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
h:
“Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy.
h:
“Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: If you want peace, accept. If you want suffering, expect.
h:
“If you want peace, accept. If you want suffering, expect.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Talk does not cook rice.
h:
“Talk does not cook rice.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
h:
“Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: There is peace even in the storm.
h:
“There is peace even in the storm.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: He that can have patience can have what he will.
h:
“He that can have patience can have what he will.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.
h:
“One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: A very little key will open a very heavy door.
h:
“A very little key will open a very heavy door.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
h:
“Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.
h:
“Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying. ” —
W. Clement Stone

q: Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it.
h:
“Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it.” —
Unknown

q: Never whine, never complain, never try to justify yourself.
h:
“Never whine, never complain, never try to justify yourself.” —
Robert Greene

q: All leaders are readers.
h:
“All leaders are readers.” —
Jim Rohn
